channel.title: Savor
channel.itunes:subtitle: Savor
channel.description: Savor digs into how people live and how they eat – and why. Hosts Anney Reese and Lauren Vogelbaum interview the culinary creators and consumers of the world, exploring the science, history, and culture of food and drink, all with a key question in mind: Why do we like what we like, and how can we find more of those things?
channel.itunes:summary: Savor digs into how people live and how they eat – and why. item.title: Introducing: OBSESSIONS: Wild Chocolate
item.itunes:title: Introducing: OBSESSIONS: Wild Chocolate
item.description:
Forget Willy Wonka and those heart-shaped Valentine’s boxes. OBSESSIONS: Wild Chocolate. is a totally different beast. Join host Rowan Jacobson as he elbows his way through the rain forest, crash lands into cocaine flyaways, and avoids a few too many anaconda, tagging along with modern-day Lara Crofts as they try to get their hands on some of the world’s most ancient– and expensive– cacao. Listen to OBSESSIONS: Wild Chocolate on the iHeartRadio app or wherever you get your podcasts. https://www.iheart.com/podcast/1119-obsessions-wild-chocolate-103468390/

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: The Health of the Food Industry
item.itunes:title: The Health of the Food Industry
item.description:
Food unites humanity, but the food industry can be a divisive place to work. We look at Asheville as a microcosm of the issues plaguing U.S. food and restaurant workers -- and of how we can come together to help solve those issues.

Humans have been enjoying yogurt and its health benefits for millennia. From prehistory to bizarre sanitarium treatments to modern marketing campaigns, we explore the culture of yogurt.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Defrosting Frozen Food
item.itunes:title: Defrosting Frozen Food
item.description:
What technologies have brought us the convenience of frozen foods? Is frozen really as nutritious as fresh? Learn what it takes scientifically to bring that bag of vegetables from the farm to your freezer.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: The Unsweetened History and Technology of Sugar
item.itunes:title: The Unsweetened History and Technology of Sugar
item.description:

item.title: Cauliflower: Fractaliscious and Nutritious
item.itunes:title: Cauliflower: Fractaliscious and Nutritious
item.description:
This seemingly humble member of the cabbage family has been prized for thousands of years by chefs, nutritionists, and mathematicians alike. Learn about cauliflower's long history, fascinating fractal shape, health benefits, and culinary potential.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Champagne (and Sparkling Wine)
item.itunes:title: Champagne (and Sparkling Wine)
item.description:
In just 400 years, sparkling wines have gone from a dangerous mistake (the famous Dom Perignon was hired to get RID of bubbles in wine) to a symbol of wealth and celebration. We trace the history and explain the science behind champagne.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
